post.description:
Lets you add consent of the customer to receive messages from the org. 

Mobile number validation is required to add consent that is generated through `otp/generate` with the `"action":"SUBSCRIPTION"`.

mobile.description: Mobile number of the customer to add consent.

consentStatus.description: Pass `yes` to provide consent to receive SMSs from the org, `no` to decline.

validationCode.description: Unique validation code received on the customer’s mobile number (for the `SUBSCRIPTIONaction`)

put.description:
Lets you update consent of the customer to receive messages from the org. 

Mobile number validation is required to update consent that is generated through `otp/generate` with the `"action":"SUBSCRIPTION"`.

mobile.description: Mobile number of the customer to add consent.

consentStatus.description: Pass `yes` to provide consent to receive SMSs from the org, `no` to decline.

validationCode.description: Unique validation code received on the customer’s mobile number (for the `SUBSCRIPTIONaction`)

post.description:
Lets you create a new card series for the org. With this API, you can do the following:

* Create auto-generated physical/digital cards for a series.
* Create physical/digital card series with auto card generation disabled.

code.description: Unique code (supports up to 50 characters) for the card series. Only alpha-numeric is allowed.

type.description: Type of the card. Use PHYSICAL for physical cards, and DIGITAL for digital cards.

expiryDays.description: Validity of the card series in number of days from the issued date. Required if expiryEnabled is true.

cardExpiryEnabled.description: Set true to enable card expiry. If it is false, then expiryDays is not applicable.

prefix.description: Preferred starting characters for the card series.

suffix.description: Ending characters for cards of the series.

offset.description: Number of rows to be ignored from the top.

length.description: Length of the cards of the series.

method.description: The card generation method. For now, only DEFAULT is supported.

cardGenerationEnabled.description: Pass true to auto-generate cards for the for the series, false to manually generate cards.

isActive.description: Pass true to activate the series.

trigger.description: When do you want to generate the card series. Use REGISTRATION (to issue card automatically when a new customer is registered), SERIES_ID (to generate cards when the series code is passed during registration), OU_ID (to generate cards when a customer is registered at a specific OU, makes a transaction or updates profile for the first time and mention the desired conceptCode).

conceptCode.description: Concept code associated with the card series. The concept is identified by the associated Till Code.

maxActiveCardsPerCustomer.description: Limit active cards per customer from the current card series.

put.description: Lets you update the details of an existing card series.

parameters.name: seriesId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the card series to update.

code.description: Unique code (supports up to 50 characters) for the card series. Only alpha-numeric is allowed.

type.description: Type of the card. Use PHYSICAL for physical cards, and DIGITAL for digital cards.

expiryDays.description: Validity of the card series in number of days from the issued date. Required if expiryEnabled is true.

cardExpiryEnabled.description: Set true to enable card expiry. If it is false, then expiryDays is not applicable.

prefix.description: Preferred starting characters for the card series.

suffix.description: Ending characters for cards of the series.

offset.description: Number of rows to be ignored from the top.

length.description: Length of the cards of the series.

method.description: The card generation method. For now, only DEFAULT is supported.

cardGenerationEnabled.description: Pass true to auto-generate cards for the for the series, false to manually generate cards.

isActive.description: Pass true to activate the series.

trigger.description: When do you want to generate the card series. Use REGISTRATION (to issue card automatically when a new customer is registered), SERIES_ID (to generate cards when the series code is passed during registration), OU_ID (to generate cards when a customer is registered at a specific OU, makes a transaction or updates profile for the first time and mention the desired conceptCode).

conceptCode.description: Concept code associated with the card series. The concept is identified by the associated Till Code.

maxActiveCardsPerCustomer.description: Limit active cards per customer from the current card series.

get.description: Retrieves the details of a specific card series.

parameters.name: seriesId
parameters.description: Unique series ID of the card to retrieve.

put.description: Lets you deactivate an active card series. Use the same body of Update Card Series and pass the parameter values as mentioned in the Body Params.

parameters.name: seriedId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the card series to deactivate.

isActive.description: Pass 0 to deactivate the card series.

type.description: Type of cards of the card series.

post.description: Lets you add or map custom status labels to standard statuses and set default label names for each status.

label.description: Custom label name for the default status.
Custom label name for the default status.

default.description: Pass true to map default values.

label.description: Custom label name for the default status to map.

default.description: Pass true to map the default value.

label.description: Custom label name to map for the default status.

default.description: Pass true for the default value mapping.

label.description: Custom label name for the default status.

default.description: Pass true to map default values.

label.description: Custom label name for the default status.

get.description: Retrieves the default status labels of cards.

get.summary: Get Configured Active Cards per Customer
get.description: Retrieves the configured maximum number of cards active cards per customer.

post.description:
Allows adding a source account to the org. Currently, the following sources are supported:

    * Facebook
    * WEB_ENGAGE
    * WECHAT
    * INSTORE
    * MARTJACK
    * TMALL
    * TAOBAO
    * JD

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the org to which new source needs to be added.

get.description: Retrieves details of a specific account based on the UUID (universally unique identifier).

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Fetch all sources of a specific org. Pass orgId.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: UUID of the source account to fetch.

put.description: Allows updating all the details of a source account except UUID and source type. You can also activate or deactivate an account using isActive tag.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the org to which new source needs to be updated.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Specify the UUID of the account that you want to modify

isActive.description: Whether the source account is active or not.

get.description: Retrieves the list of all account accounts of an org.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Fetch all sources of a specific org. Pass orgId.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Pass true to fetch all source details.

get.description: ​ Retrieves the configuration details of a specific source.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the org.

parameters.name: sourceId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the source account.

get.description: Retrieves the organization configuration values based on config name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the configuration key to fetch details.

post.description: Lets you enable a standard event for the current org.

parameters.name: event_name
parameters.description: Name of the standard event that you want to enable.

parameters.name: use_standard_adapter_mappings
parameters.description: Pass `true` to use standard adapter mapping.

get.description: Retrieves meta details of all event Fields configured for the organization.
Retrieves the meta information of all the standard events. This includes event level data such as event name, category, consumed by modules (actions), and detailed information of each field.

post.description:
Lets you map a custom event to the defaultTransformer (standard fields). Use this if you do not want need field level mapping and consider only standard fields for the event.

For example, if you create a custom event by directly adding one or more standard events without creating new custom fields, you can map the event to `defaultTransformer`.

You can also map a transformer to an event and associate event fields (mapping with custom fields).

transformerType.description:
Pass `defaultTransformer` to map the custom event to the default transformer.
Pass `WebEngageTransformer` to associate the event with custom fields.
Support for more transformer types is in progress.

eventsMapped.description: Event names that you want to map to the `defaultTransformer` or third-party event. Separate each event with a comma (,).

eventFieldName.description: Name of the field event at the Capillary end. Required for custom mapping.

fieldName.description: Name of the field event as in the third party source. Required for custom mapping.

eventMapper.description: Map even fields of Capillary with the third party. You need to pass individual schema for each event. For example, CustomerEvent as shown in the Sample POST Request.

eventFieldName.description: Name of the field as in the Capillary

fieldName.description: Name of the field as in the third-party source.

eventFieldMapper.description: Map even fields of Capillary with the third party. You need to pass individual schema for each event. For example, CustomerEvent as shown in the Sample POST Request.

get.description: Retrieves org events' adapter mapping details.

put.description: Lets you disable an existing event. You cannot restore an event once disabled.

parameters.name: event_name
parameters.description: Name of the event to disable.

get.description: Retrieves the details of predefined integrations (transformer) (field mappings).
Retrieves details of all Webhook accounts created for the organization. An org can have one Webhook account per transformer.

put.description: Lets you disable a specific Webhook account.

webHookId.description: Unique ID of the webhook to disable.

get.description: Retrieves the details of all points earned for a transaction.

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the transaction to fetch earnings.

get.description: Triggers customer walkin notifications on InStore. That is, when a customer walks in to the store, InStore triggers a desktop notification with the customer details.

parameters.name: till_code
parameters.description: Destination TILL code where you want to push the notification.

parameters.name: identifierName
parameters.description: Identifier tracked when the customer walked in.

parameters.name: identifierValue
parameters.description: The respective identifier value.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Source in which the provided customer identifier is available.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Specific account ID of the source (for sources with multiple account ids).

post.description: This API lets you configure a extended field for the org and manage whether to show or hide it on your org’s InTouch.

extendedFieldId.description: Unique ID of the extended field.

hideDisplay.description: Pass `true` to hide the field, `false` to show.

mandatory.description: Pass true to make the extended a mandatory option on the UI, false to make it an optional field.

updatable.description: Specify true to allow updating extended field values once entered, false to disable updating extended field values. Applicable for Instore. No server side validation.

position.description: The position order of the extended field on the UI.

isPsiData.description: Indicates if the extended field is sensitive data

isPiiData.description: Indicates if the extended field is Personally Identifiable Information. Refer to the PSI data documentation for more [information on classifying PSI data](https://docs.capillarytech.com/docs/classify-potentially-sensitive-information-psi)

Sample Response.value:
{
    "extendedFieldId": 570,
    "hideDisplay": false,
    "isPiiData": false,
    "isPsiData": true,
    "updatable": true,
    "mandatory": false,
    "rejectTxnOnInvalidValue": false,
    "auditTrailEnabled": false,
    "warnings": []
}

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Source from which the event is made.

get.summary: Get Configured Card Limit per Customer
get.description: Retrieves the configured maximum number of cards active cards per customer.

post.description: This lets you add a new vertical to an org.

orgId.description: Unique ID of the org for which you want to add a vertical.

verticalId.description: Unique ID of the vertical to add.

isActive.description: Status of the vertical - ‘true` to activate.

get.description: Retrieves the list of verticals enabled for the org (active verticals).

delete.description: This lets you remove a vertical from the org.

parameters.name: vericalId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the vertical to delete.

get.description: Retrieves the list of all verticals available for the org. This include both active and inactive verticals.

post.description: Lets you create the business hierarchy for the org.

description.description: A short description of the hierarchy.

pointsAggregationRole.description:
To create a group implicitly, set both pointsAggregationRole and autoGroupCreationEnabled to true. The user in the current role will become the owner of the group. All the other users conjoined with the user in the hierarchy will be included automatically and become the members of the group.
Example: Assume A > B > C > D as the roles in a hierarchy. A is the parent of B. B is the parent of C. C is the parent of D. Set pointsAggregationRole to true for the role C to get a user registered. The group is also automatically created along with this command. The user in role C will now be the owner of the group. All the users associated with the user C, in roles A, B and D are also automatically added as members of the group.

autoGroupCreationEnabled.description: Pass `true` to auto-create a group. At least one role should have pointsAggregationRole set to true.

code.description: Unique code of the role in the hierarchy.

childRoleCode.description: Unique code of the child role (if any) associated with the current role.

maxChild.description: Maximum number of child users that can be associated with the user in the current role. Maximum value: 30000.

permissionCode.description: Unique code of the permission. Values: block_points_redemption, block_points_transfer, earn_points.

permissionValue.description: Set true to enable and false to disable the code.

roles.description: Roles and permissions of the hierarchy. You need to have at least 2 roles for a hierarchy and can extend up to 8 (max).

hierarchyCreationStrict.description: Pass false set user level permissions and group creation which will override the hierarchy configurations. Set true to strictly follow hierarchy configurations.

skipRoleAllowed.description: Pass `true` to allow skip-level parent child associations. For example, if A>B>C>D are the roles in a hierarchy where A is the parent of B and so on. We allow associations like A>C, A>D, B>D. Pass `false`, hierarchy is followed strictly according to the sequence.

put.description: Lets you update an existing business hierarchy for the org.

parameters.name: hierarchyId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the fleet to update.

description.description: A short description of the hierarchy.

pointsAggregationRole.description:
To create a group implicitly, set both pointsAggregationRole and autoGroupCreationEnabled to true. The user in the current role will become the owner of the group. All the other users conjoined with the user in the hierarchy will be included automatically and become the members of the group.
Example: Assume A > B > C > D as the roles in a hierarchy. A is the parent of B. B is the parent of C. C is the parent of D. Set pointsAggregationRole to true for the role C to get a user registered. The group is also automatically created along with this command. The user in role C will now be the owner of the group. All the users associated with the user C, in roles A, B and D are also automatically added as members of the group.

autoGroupCreationEnabled.description: Pass `true` to auto-create a group. At least one role should have pointsAggregationRole set to true.

code.description: Unique code of the role in the hierarchy.

childRoleCode.description: Unique code of the child role (if any) associated with the current role.

maxChild.description: Maximum number of child users that can be associated with the user in the current role. Maximum value: 30000.

permissionCode.description: Unique code of the permission. Values: block_points_redemption, block_points_transfer, earn_points.

permissionValue.description: Set true to enable and false to disable the code.

roles.description: Roles and permissions of the hierarchy. You need to have at least 2 roles for a hierarchy and can extend up to 8 (max).

hierarchyCreationStrict.description: Pass false set user level permissions and group creation which will override the hierarchy configurations. Set true to strictly follow hierarchy configurations.

skipRoleAllowed.description: Pass `true` to allow skip-level parent child associations. For example, if A>B>C>D are the roles in a hierarchy where A is the parent of B and so on. We allow associations like A>C, A>D, B>D. Pass `false`, hierarchy is followed strictly according to the sequence.

get.description: Retrieves details of a specific hierarchy. You cannot fetch the details of an inactive hierarchy.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID of the fleet to retrieve.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Unique code of the hierarchy.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID of the fleet to delete.

get.description: Retrieves the details of all hierarchies configured for the org.
